solution_line_template: If Tenisha has {total_dogs} dogs, the number of female dogs is {female_percentage}*{total_dogs} = {female_dogs}

{birth_fraction} of the females give birth, meaning {birth_fraction}*{female_dogs} = <<{birth_fraction}*{female_dogs}={female_dogs_giving_birth}>>{female_dogs_giving_birth} female dogs gives birth to puppies.

Since each dog that gave birth had {puppies_per_dog} puppies, the number of puppies that were born is {female_dogs_giving_birth}*{puppies_per_dog} = <<{female_dogs_giving_birth}*{puppies_per_dog}={total_puppies_born}>>{total_puppies_born}
After donating {donated_puppies} puppies to the church, Tenisha remained with {total_puppies_born}-{donated_puppies} = {remaining_puppies} puppies.
